Mental Leaks â†’ Self Limiting Beliefs
Mental Blocks are not congenital, they are environmental
There's a difference in being poor, and being broke
Poor is a state of mind, broke is a temporary situation
Your Potential is Limitless, your output, however, is controlled by your "Self-Limiting Beliefs"
You are in control of you
"Do crackheads go out and say 'Oh I can't get high today, I'm too poor'? NO. They go out and make shit happen!"

Once you learn to take note of the things you are grateful for, you will start to forget about the things that you lack. And eventually, you will make up for those as well.

Formal education will get you educated. Self-education will make you wealthy


Judgemental Listening â†’ Jumping to conclusions about the person you are listening to
Selecting Listening â†’ Only listening to what you want to hear; only responding to the content that is of your particular interest
Impatient Listening â†’ Waiting for the other person to finish speaking before you
Egocentric Listening â†’ Turning the conversation to oneself
Patronizing Listening â†’ Pretending you are listening when you are not
Stubborn Listening â†’ Listening but already having made up your mind

You need to trust people to be trustworthy


There is strength in struggle

Start by listening or reading actively, and jot down the main ideas and supporting details in the Note-taking Column.

Cue 3

After the lecture or reading, review your notes as soon as possible to reinforce the information in your memory.



The Cornell Note-taking System is a popular and effective method for organizing and summarizing information during lectures, readings, or any other form of learning.
Cue 4
The Cornell method offers a specific layout for each page of notes. The note is devided into three sections:

Cue Column (Left) â€” is used to write down questions, keywords, or cues related to the content you're recording in the main notes section.

Cue 5

Start by listening or reading actively, and jot down the main ideas and supporting details in the Note-taking Column.

Cue 6

After the lecture or reading, review your notes as soon as possible to reinforce the information in your memory.



Write a concise summary here The Cornell Note-taking System is effective because it encourages active engagement during the note-taking process and provides a structured way to review and study the material later. It is widely used by students, professionals, and anyone looking to improve their note-taking and learning efficiency.

item.description:
#PersonalDevelopment/mentalAttributes/intelligence/knowledge/business #Business #Meeting-Notes



If you call your upline, your business is growing. If your upline calls you, their business is growing
If you want to deal with your past, take a marker, draw a line behind you, and tell yourself "I'm never going back"




dsasd




Is the ability to accomplish your goals a decision, or a skill?
VCS Requirements
Customer's Name
A valid Mobile Phone Number
The list of products sold which are on the inventory list
Learn 300 PV and teach 24 people to get there





Don't pass negative to Downline or Cross line
Don't mess with anyone's spouse or significant other
Don't mess with anyone's money or ego



Focus on the moment
Every defeat, heartbreak, loss, adversity is it's own seed, it's own lesson, on how to improve our performance for next time


Sustainable business â†’ EP40
EP40 Trip â†’




"Being All In"
When you can go through everything, and still have a smile on your face, and a positive attitude, that's when you know you are all in, and that you are on the right path



The point of building this business (or indeed in Succeeding in anything) is to do it with enough frequency and consistency to reap results. The most fundamental quality this requires is tolerance for failure
Accept the things you can not control, and identify the things you can. The things you can control, are the things you wake up every day and fight for, because that's a fight you can win
Extreme Ownership



Position yourself in such a way that you are profitable no matter what you do in your business
Once you know "The Way" of something, all things stem from this knowledge â†’ in knowing one thing, you know a thousand
You can't control where your business is going to grow, but you have to help those people

You need to have a goal or vision for people to connect to



"Success is a progressive realization of a worthy ideal"
Define your vision to find meaning and purpose
"I wish I only had the courage to have lived for myself"



Failure is not the opposite of success; quitting is
Three Pillars
Generate Volume
Sponsor New Legs in Width
Add Depth to Legs



Taking Ownership of Your Business
Habits â†’ Successful People Practice Good Habits â†’ Successful Businesses are Led by Those with Good Habits
"7 Habits of Highly Effective People"


Resilience
Vision
Adaptability
Passion
Decisiveness
Risk Tolerance
Strong Work Ethic
Jkfd ???
Networking Ability



The Three Powers
Power of Unity
Power of Submission
Power of the Spoken Word
The Greatest Loss is the Loss of Self-Respect
The Ugliest Personality Trait - Selfishness
The greatest sleep medication - Peace of mind
Greatest problem to overcome - fear
The most crippling disease in history - excuses
The most dangerous act - Gossip
The Most Contagious Spirit - Enthusiasm
Life ends when you stop breathing
Hope ends when you stop believing
Love ends when you stop caring




If there was a "Villain" in your life who was trying to prevent you from Succeeding, what would they do?
DOUBT
They would try to instill doubt in you
DISCOURAGEMENT
They would try to discourage you from continuing
DELUSION
If you're life was a book, what would the Title be? Who would the author be?




It's not easy to change beliefs, because they have been with you for years
The only person who can "install" Faith in you is yourself




Team players bring out the best in everyone around them

item.title: 2024-08-09 - FIRST SESSION
item.description:
#Business #Meeting-Notes
Topics
Multi column Blank container Blank container SESSION ONE â€“ Friday, August 9th, 2024

Skepticism


This business is for everyone
Book of the Month: The Power of a Team
Healthy Relationships require a minimum of 5 positive interactions for every 1 negative interaction
When the ratio approaches 1:1, you approach the point of the relationship falling apart



The Why

You need to have a why â†’ this gives you the courage to overcome

What to Do When You Get Back


Educate Yourself
Attend every event you qualify for
Complete your Personal Circle
150 PV for Singles
300 PV for Couples
Add 1 new Name every day

"Don't judge your day by fruit you were able to harvest, judge your day by the seeds your have planted" â€“ Sonica Jain

Movers & Shakers Panel

Verified Customer Sales
"Why BSM Pro?"
People & Products
Have a Growing List



Verified Customer Sales


Place an order through you MyShop
Go through the Amway Website
Use the share feature for a product
Sell out of your inventory



The mistake most people make is stopping when they think they aren't getting results



"Why BSM Pro?"

BSM Xstream Pro is a platform that gives us access to the successful people in this business, and the opportunity to learn from them
You should NOT be the system for your team; plug your team into the system

Talks to Listen To

The Basics of MG1 by Sugeet Ajmani
Dancing Monkies & Dark Circles by Shivaram Kumar
Crown Mindset by Kanti Gala
Mentality of a Business Owner by Kaajal Ajmani
My Last Day on the Job by Angelo Nardone
1469 Days by Sugeet Ajmani
Chinese Bamboo Tree by Paul Miller



Products & People

Our business has two pillars: products and people
Without products, our business produces no compensation
Without people, our business can not move products
Everyone has a network that they have the opportunity to maximize for their own benefit, and the benefit of those in their network



Having a Growing List

Having a constantly & consistently growing list is what will allow you to build your business from a position of strength and abundance



The Six Cardinal Rules

The Cardinal Rules Ground Your Business
Launch people of Quality â†’ at your level or above


Don't mess with anybody's Ego (do not embarrass anyone)
Don't mess with anybody's Money
Don't mess with anybody's spouse


Never do anything for the First time without checking with your growing upline
Never pass negative to a downline or a cross line
Use a "Sandwich" approach - Positive-Negative-Positive
Never Embarrass your Upline or Downline

"Success is not complimentary. Pray as if it depends on God. Work as if it depends on YOU" â€“ Sanjeev Sahay



How to Do Meet & Greets

You need to take ownership from the beginning


Primary Goal: Get to know one another
Most important part of the process
Learn to Convey your own excitement to the candidate; if you don't seem passionate about what you're doing, it will be near Impossible to try to get someone else to catch the excitement
There is no timeline when completing a Meet & Greet
Listen to their story â†’ their story will have clues that will help you direct the flow of conversation during the Meet & Greet

Talks to Listen To

BWW2083 Basics of MG1
Process Mindset by Sugeet Ajmani
BWW2043 Meet & Greet Mindset



Showing the Plan

The Growth of your Business is proportional to how many new people you show the Business Plan to
Options for Showing the Plan
One-on-One â†’ Builds Connection
Transferring Belief needs to be done in-person
EVERYONE needs encouragement
Home Meeting
Board Plan/Team Meeting â†’ Builds Conviction
The Environment of a BWW Event pulls people in
If you're worried about messing up, do it more
The worst plan is the plan that you don't show
The only number you have to think about is Twenty Plans a Month



Follow Up & Follow Through

At the Follow Up Stage, you are already 80% of the way there
Be sure to provide your candidate with talks and ensure that they have taken the time to listen to them
If someone is NOT ready to learn (i.e. did not listen to the talks), they are not ready for entrepreneurship
Ask them questions about what their takeaways were
Addressing Questions

Write down the questions that they have

"If we are able to answer most if not all of these questions today, what, if anything, would stop you from getting started today?" â€“ Mansoor Wahidi

Resources

BWW2899 - Follow Up & Follow Through - Rob Shannon
BWW2578 - Putting it All Together - Esmin & Kulsuma Feritovich



Our Business is a Feeling Business

Your goal is to Have Your Own Meeting
This business is about experience



Overcoming Obstacles


People will say that they are not interested
People will quit

"The Business is simple. LIFE is complicated" â€“ Bill Britt



How to Sell the Products
How to Show the Plan



In order for you to have a massive team, there has to come a point where you get over yourself and get over your fears
"Don't keep yourself from saying 'Hi!' just because you are afraid of hearing 'Bye!' " â€“ Stephanie Nwoke

At least do something â†’ Take your business one day at a time


Here is the summary that I have written ``` Session One of Gala Summer Conference 2024 provides a comprehensive overview of the strategies, principles, and mindsets emphasized by various speakers for success in the Amway business. Key topics included the importance of maintaining healthy relationships, having a clear "why" to drive perseverance, consistently expanding oneâ€™s network, and leveraging tools like BSM Xstream Pro for learning. Practical advice was given on customer sales, showing the business plan, and conducting effective follow-ups. Speakers emphasized the significance of personal growth, overcoming obstacles, and taking ownership in business interactions, highlighting that success in this field requires both strategic action and a positive, resilient mindset. ```

item.description:
#Business #Meeting-Notes
Movers & Shakers
Multi column Blank container Blank container SESSION TWO â€“ Saturday, August 10th, 2024

Professionals in the Business



If you ask a professional what their idea of the "Perfect Job" is, they will most likely say the following:
No Boss
No Alarm Clock
No Commute
No Discrimination
No "Getting Laid Off"
No Stress
In most cases, achieving this requires creating some sort of asset-based income

How to Consistently Create Customers



Ask your loyal customers if they know anyone who the products you have given them will benefit
Get to know your products so you know what to recommend to people based on their needs

The Power of Unity



Your upline has your best interest at heart
The opposite of unity is not division, although that is a byproduct. It's chaos and destruction

The Power of Submission



Being in submission puts you in a position of Power â†’ Your mentor will be careful in ensuring that you succeed because they know that you will do what they say
"Advice that is not asked for is criticism." â€“ Nidhi Bhattacharyya

Huddle with your upline the first opportunity you get every month
When your upline becomes a coach and a mentor rather than you're friend, you are truly in submission

The Power of the Spoken Word



We all live at the level of what and how we speak


Products & People

Our business has two pillars: products and people
Without products, our business produces no compensation
Without people, our business can not move products
Everyone has a network that they have the opportunity to maximize for their own benefit, and the benefit of those in their network



Putting Together a Q12 Business

Putting together a team of 40 people is a solid Q12 Business
Are you taking the time to build the connections with the people you are working with?
Be Intention

item.description:

item.title: Hosting Guidelines Notes
item.description:
#PersonalDevelopment/mentalAttributes/intelligence/knowledge/business #Business #Meeting-Notes




Reach meeting location latest by 7:40 PM.
Confirm all AV equipment is in working condition.


First announcement at 8:00 PM local time.
Second announcement at 8:03 PM local time.
Hand off to speaker at 8:05 PM local time.
Edify speaker before bringing them up. Refer to AIC speaker intro notes prior to the meeting and stick to it.


What to do when speaker intro is unavailable?
Polish shoes.
No teaching or stories during introduction, even during training intro.
A couple of BWW appropriate jokes are fine.


Training should start by 9:20 PM or 7 minutes after BP ends in case of exceptions like Diamond or external speaker.
No teaching or stories before bringing speaker up.
Keep introduction to 1-2 minutes. Just edify the speaker.
Wrap Up: Check with upline meeting host on any announcements of upcoming events.



Business casuals.
Reach meeting location by 7:45 PM.
Check with Pase meeting location host if any help is needed for setup.


Making coffee.
Putting out chairs.
Helping in clean up after Pase.
Confirm all AV equipment is in working condition & Zoom link is working.
Edify each presenter before bringing them up. Check with respective uplines for 1-2 qualities that can be highlighted.
Remember, you as a host create and maintain the energy in the room.

1. This is a super good way for me to transition from Personal Background to Business

The goals you accomplish sometimes are not as important as the growth you receive in pursuing them
Lot's of things can be complimentary, but your time cannot be "I do 5-7 meetings for everyone who has a desire to sponsor people" \ - Bill Britt - "6-6-8-6-6"



What is Sustained performance? â†’ Performance that can be duplicated and maintained
What leads to Sustained performance? â†’ Self-Leadership
Ask yourself: "Are you allowing your perspective to change because the business got tougher for you?"



Overthinking â†’ Anything you are thinking that gets in the way of your goal is overthinking
Living in the Past â†’ Preoccupation with how things happened before can lead to burnout
Inability to Deal with Uncertainty â†’ Nothing is guaranteed; You need to be able to handle the ups and downs, and ADAPT



Givers â†’ People who prioritize giving to others, without the necessity of having received first
Takers â†’ People who prioritize receiving from others without giving anything in return
Matchers â†’ People who prioritize receiving something from others before they are willing to give anything in return





You can't build a large business until & unless you are an effective communicator
For people to receive your message, there needs to be positive intent, and positive impact
K.I.S.S â†’ Keep It Simple, Stupid
Leadership
Equipping
Attitude
Relationships

Physical Energy - Importance of a healthy lifestyle, including nutrition, exercise, and sleep
Mental Energy - Techniques for mental focus & clariy
Emotional Energy - Managing emotions to sustain necessary energy levels


Vision & Goals - How setting big dreams can increase your energy
Motivation - Dreams as a source of motivation and drive
Purpose - How dreams provide a sense of purpose and direction


Positive Mindset - Developing a positive outlook on life
Gratitude Practice - Daily practices to cultivate gratitude
Affirmations - Using positive affirmations to boost morale


Synergy - How dreams, energy, and positive vibes interconnect. ** â€“Stay**
Optimism - Envisioning success and fostering a positive outlook
Resilience - Building resilience to stay positive and energetic despite challenges


Self-Awareness - Techniques to become aware of negative thoughts and replace them with positive ones
Goal Setting - Setting & achieving goals to stay motivated - Best way is doing the 9 CORE Steps **religiously**


Show the Plan - Showing presentations consistently is key to growing your business. Aim for at least 30 presentations a month
100% Product Use - Be your own best customer. Use the products to develop your own product story and build belief in them
Develop Customers - Have personal retail customers at all times. This provides immediate profits and helps teach your team.


BSM Xstream Audio - Listening to talks to keep you inspired and help you in course correction
Read Every Day - Reading books daily is one of the fastest ways to learn new skills and improve mindset, attitude, and outlook on life
Attend all Associations - Associations provide camaraderie and are the glue that keeps our business together
BWW Tech Tools - Subscribe to & leverage all BWW Tech Tools and use BWW Technology effectively


Huddle with Coach - Stay coachable and follow the lead of successful mentors - Be a student before becoming a teacher - Stay plugged in with your active upline
Accountability/Integrity - Do what you say you will do - Find an Accountability partner to help stay motivated and consistent - Actions speak louder than words.Align your actions with your words

Here is the summary that I have written
Training focused on strategies for effective e-commerce and team management. Key points included the importance of striving for promotions, maintaining organization, and developing a consistent business rhythm. Attendees were advised to differentiate between activity and productivity, manage their schedules effectively, and set daily goals. Emphasis was placed on adhering to a structured activity plan, receiving guidance from an upline coach, and maintaining daily communication with them. The seminar also highlighted nine core steps, including showing the business plan regularly and ensuring full product use, with specific volume targets for individual and couple IBOs. A motivational quote by Khalid Motorwala underscored the value of perseverance in personal development.


What A Productive Calendar Looks Like by Saji & Sushma Kumar (BWW3033)
Description: This podcast discusses how to be productive in business by making extraordinary decisions. It aligns well with the themes of maintaining a booked calendar and daily goal-setting emphasized in your training.
Effective Game Planning And Counseling With Your Upline by Subroto & Sangeeta Bhattacharya and Shivam Chandan & Therese George (BWW2978)
Description: This podcast covers effective game planning with your upline and building the right structure, which directly relates to your training on developing a rhythm and working the plan.
Loyalty by Joe & Roxy Galatolo (BWW3029)
Description: This podcast discusses the role of loyalty and consistency in business growth, which can provide insights into staying organized and committed, as discussed in your training.

Cues


"You will never grow beyond the bounds of your self-imageâ€¦stop beating yourself up and work on raising your self-image" -Sugeet Ajmani

Your job this weekend is to get your belief to the extent that you are willing to put in the effort.
Raising your self-image is the name of the game.
Those with large organizations are those who can raise the self-image of everyone on their team
Speak what you want that you don't currently have â†’ speak into existence the things that you want that are opposed to your current situation
You growth is directly proportional to your willingness to learn
The day that you think that you have NOTHING to learn, your business will start going backward
Your humility will play a big role in your growth


Journey from Ruby to Diamond
"If you want to be backstage, you have to differentiate yourself from the 80% of people who want to be but aren't"
Lily
"Growth means dealing with new problems & obstacles" -Aaron

"The Three Things We Did to Grow in the Last Year"
BSM Xstream Pro
Counseling
Focus on Growth at EVERY MEETING

Choose to Win

Being stubborn is okay, but can you redirect that stubbornness to Productivity?


Belief

Weak people will quit; strong leaders will repel
"Leadership Paradox" â†’ Confidence tempered with humility
- On stage, you talk as if you are right
- One-on-one, you talk as if you are wrong "Unity without Honesty will lead to Conspiracy" -Lakshmi

Host: Suresh Raghavan
"The Secret is Giving and Forgiving" -Bashir
"Private Victory Precedes Public Victory"
Suresh Raghavan

Unless the posture is right, and the skillset is right, the rest of the process will not work. Because your posture is the first thing the other person sees

Finances

Study your daily finances and keep track of where your money goes
Don't spend more than what you make; ensure to invest more in your personal development than your entertainment

How to Evolve & Master Your Skillset
"If you gave me six hours to chop down a tree, I would spend the first five sharpening my axe" -Habso Ali

Three God-Given Abilities That Everyone Starts with
Read
Listen
Associate

Promotion & Education

Every person in this room is the system
You are a part of this system, and the people on your team all form this system

Host: Saji Kumar - Having the products on hand will encourage you to **move** them >[!quote] _"Build the business with a Happy Heart. The vibration you put out will determine what you get back"_ > -Vijay
"A Closed Mouth is a Closed Business" -Rita


Delayed Gratification
If you buy things or do things to impress people, you will find yourself with no one around you to be impressed -Shalu Mahraj
"When I lost my Excuses, I found my Reason. When I lost my fear, I found my Strength. When I lost my Hesitance, I found my Purpose. When I lost my darkness, I found my Light" -Murli Mahraj
"The best way to find yourself is to lost yourself in the service of others"
Mahatma Gandhi

The secret is to turn your excuses into reasons

Hard Work & Discipline To Go Diamond - The best investment you can make is in yourself -

Relationships - Empathy & Understanding - Put yourself in other people's shoes - Offer support when needed - Personal growth - Associating â†’ Learn what to do, and what not to do, from those who have achieved what you wish to achieve - Seek advice from your mentors/coaches/upline - Accept constructive criticism - Decide to be happy - Learn to let go, and move on

Sacrifice >[!quote] You must sacrifice for what you want, or what you want will **be** the sacrifice > -Luna Le

Diamonds & Up Panel - Functions in Order of Importance: - Amway Trips - Whatever is not your business, is **none** of your business - Don't let a little molehill become a mountain because you did not address it when you needed to -


Write a Short Summary Here
My notes center around the concepts of delayed gratification, hard work, empathy, personal growth, and sacrifice. The quotes I've gathered emphasize the importance of turning excuses into reasons, finding purpose through overcoming personal limitations, and discovering oneself through serving others. Notable figures such as Shalu Mahraj, Murli Mahraj, and Mahatma Gandhi underscore these principles. In the context of achieving success, especially in ventures like going diamond in Amway, I am reminded that the best investment is in oneself, and the journey involves hard work and discipline. From mentors like Naren and Priya Kumar, and Jitsu and Reema Alam, I've learned the significance of empathy, understanding, and continuous personal growth. Sacrifice is also a recurring theme, highlighted by Luna Le's insight that one must sacrifice for their goals, or risk losing them. Finally, the importance of addressing issues promptly to avoid them escalating into major problems is stressed, aligning with the notion that what isn't my business should remain out of my focus.

item.title: TRAINING
item.description:
Cues



Lorem Ipsum Doler

Staying Focused
"Do the goals that you have set, set you up for bigger goals in the future?" -Misa Do

Giving up something GREATER, for something LESSER, is SACRIFICE
Giving up something LESSER, for something GREATER, is INVESTMENT
You can not really stay focused on a goal, in your comfort zone

Intangibles of the Business #### Tangibles - Car: Jaguar F-Type â†’ $200K - House: 5000+ Square Feet, 2+ Acres â†’ $1.5 Million - Children's Education Paid Off â†’ $1.5 Million - Travel to Every Country in the World â†’


You can not assign a dollar value to the Intangibles
I want to live my life entirely in the present. Free of the burden of the past, and free of fear of the future.
I want to experience everything that is available to me in this life
I want the freedom to spend every day with my wife, children, and family and choose what we do

The Golden Principle - Building a large, successful business is as much about what you do, as it is about what you stand for - Holding on to your baggage of the past is something that is visible to those you interact with. They can see the burden you carry. And when you are trying to share with them freedom, bearing such a burden only serves to make you a hypocrite. A False Prophet. - ==Learn to retain your innocence==

Width & Depth - You have not launched ANYBODY until you have launched somebody for them - You go wide, so THAT you can go deep - Feel Proud that your upline believes that you are capable of leading this organization

Skillset - When you launch someone, granting them the skills to get results is the first priority

Loyalty >[!quote] Blood makes you related; Loyalty makes you a family > -Saji Kumar

Activation Energy >[!quote] Every pin in this business has an activation energy; until you create that energy that growth will not show up > -Ali Gashon

If you are stuck, it is because you are confusing the difference between you, and your thoughts.
Results come when what you do is aligned with why you are doing it
You cannot have a hard head, and a soft heart

How to Be Happy

An average IBO does not go Diamond; so how do you differentiate yourself from where you at to where you want to go?
Belief & Action


6 Businesses at T10 BBI and Above
Ruby Volume will be done
Learn to Sponsor
Character is shown when you are in the Valleys, not when you are on the mountaintop
Stop Judging
Depth is not hard; it is about friendships
Happiness >[!quote] Happiness is within us; it's already there. Stop searching. > -Sugeet Ajmani

You need to search within yourself to find what is destroying your happiness
It is your responsibility to make yourself happy
Misery is self-created; no one can make you miserable
Happiness is in the process of accomplishing a worthwhile goal in the service of mankind
The more you create resistance to life, the more you will have to fight to live
Eet eez wut Eet eez
Happiness is in the love of the work you do

CourseNote/


Subject:: Date:: Tuesday, January 3rd 2023 Professor/Speaker:: Shivaram & Anjali Kumar Tags::



How many people have I met one-on-one | how many new friendships have I developed
Write down your goals for the month & rate yourself on the 9 core steps
Go 2 deep for every 1 wide
This is not limited to your personal legs, drive depth IN the leg at a 2 to 1 ratio of depth and width
Depth requires A|B-List
Thoughts are things, but most thougts are fake - thoughts about the past or future are simply a perspective. The only thing that truly has any significance are the thoughts we HAVE about those things IN THE MOMENT
How to stop overthinking - if it makes you feel bad, acknowledge it, and let it go
Draw your group out EVERY DAY
Unseen controls the seen
If you really believe in it, there will be ways that it will happen



"Get Lost in the Song"
It's not the mechanics
Less than 10% of your interaction with people should be "instruction"
Feeling "superior" in your technical ability compared to your downlines is a massive detriment - you need to TRUST them to do work on their own and to make mistakes and figure it out the same way you did
Creating a pull
The top-most level of leadership is "WHO YOU ARE"
Start setting up weekly power hour
Need to make brainstorm ways to make these more appealing to them AND me
Want to grow to the point of a weekly huddle for my team
If you don't have a local group, it is very difficult to be productive, since you are limited by zoom
F2F Contacting, increase focus on NJ/NY/CT/PA Area
Whoever comes up with a goal has to come up with a plan

item.title: 2024-07-13 - KUMAR TEAM COVERDISH
item.description:
#Business #Meeting-Notes
Cues

Removing incongruencies between your thoughts and actions


How to Build Momentum

5 Plans per Week â†’
15-20 Numbers per Week â†’
30-40 DTMs per Week
Priorities

Faith â†’ "Maintain your spiritual and emotional well being"
Family â†’ "Learn to prioritize which family events require your attendance"
Job â†’ "Your primary source of income. Maintain your employment."
Business â†’ "The Goose that Laid the Golden Egg"
"People are not looking for 'intense leadership'. They are looking for someone who is accountable and consistent." â€“ Sugeet Ajmani
Putting the Team Together




A & B-List â†’ Put together a list of 50-75 names
Quality of People Matter â†’ Look for people who are at and above your ambition level
At or above your income level

"I recently got selected to work with a team of entrepreneurs and I'm excited to start my own web-based business under their guidance. They are expanding their team and looking to bring on new partners. Wanted to check with you, if you keep your options open for opportunities outside of your full-time job(endeavors)?" â€“ DTM Example

"What is it or what do you do?"
"That's a fantastic question, it is a web-based business. They have partnered with a few major companies and are helping them expand their online presence using social media."

"That's a fantastic question. It's an opportunity to use the latest online trends and build a business community."

"If you are interested to learn more, it would be best to setup a time to sit down and dusciss further. Let me know if weekday evenings work week or weekends are better."

"Let's sit down over a cup of coffee and I will walk through the details. Do weekday evenings work well, or are weekends better?"
For any other questions, like 'Can you tell me more?' or 'What will be my role?', etc. respond as follows:
"That's a great question, I will make sure that we discuss this when we sit down together. Which one works better for you, weekday evenings or weekends?"

or



"Show me a leg that is 5 deep from you at a meeting."

BWW2806 Title: Programming Your Mind for Success Speakers: Sugeet & Kaajal Ajmani Categories: Teaching; New Releases




Multi column Blank container Overcome Even the Greatest Challenges with Courage and Confidence by John C. Maxwell Blank container


Embracing hardship as a test of character and use them as rising to the occasion.
Leaders are keepers and communicators of the vision. Bear the responsibility for always seeing the big picture and helping their people to see it.
Values are the heart of your character and your leadership.
Leaders role is not to control people or stay on top of things, but rather guide, energize and excite.
Good leaders deal successfully with the diversity and differences of their team and leverage the for the benefit of the team and organization.
